body.raw: Australia is proving that its wines have quality and diversity in abundance. With a land mass of more than 7.5 million sq km, you could fit England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland into Australia 30 times, and still have a bit left over. It's not surprising therefore that climates and topography are varied. The best wine-producing regions are located on the southern side of the country.
